comments:
This behavior seems to be new for 3.1M5; I did not see it with M4. 

I have a workspace with 2 versions of the same plug-in (com.sas.test.simplemenu)
and 2 versions of the same feature, each version containing one of the plugins.
Versions are 1.0.0 and 1.0.1 I'll attach these projects. 

I then do the following:

1) create a new update site project (File->New->Project..., Update Site Project),
2) Use the Add Feature... button to add just the 1.0.0 feature
3) attempt to build the feature. 

I get a dialog telling me:

"Unable to find plugin: com.sas.test.simplemenu_1.0.0. Please check the error
log for details." At this point I don't see anything interesting in the
.metadata/.log, and there is also no logs.zip file generated. 

If I add the 1.0.1 feature, that builds fine, but the 1.0.0 build still fails.
The only way can get 1.0.0 to build is if the 1.0.1 plugin is not in the
workspace at all. 

There is another problem that seems to happen during recovery from this error.
If I hit ok on the dialog box, the PDE Export dialog just seems to hang with
"Operation in progress...  Refreshing update-site". At this point I need to run
it in the background, and cancel the bottom operation. Sometime during this
process, I get the following in .metadata/.log:

Created an attachment (id=18152)
Projects that demonstate the problem
*** Bug 86944 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

PDE mimics the runtime behaviour: it can only have one version of a given plug-
in at a time.
Better warnings could be provided at the level of the project.
Moving to PDE UI for consideration.

I understand what you are saying about the runtime, but shouldn't an update site
be able to contain multiple versions of the same feature?

yes, an update site should be able to contain multiple versions of the same 
feature.
However, right now, you cannot build all those features at the same time, 
since PDE does not support development of more than one plugin with the same 
id in the same workspace.

I ran into this problem also. My workspace has only a single plugin with a 
given id. My problem is that I can't:

1) modify the plugin version #
2) modify its feature's version #
3) reference the new plugin version from the feature
4) build the new feature version
what do you mean you "can't modify the plugin version", etc.?

If I modify the plugin version number (and the feature accordingly) then Build 
fails with the cited error. Inotherwords, So I can make the version # change, 
but if I do then Build gives this error.

Konrad, please investigate the claim.

Also make sure the feature export job exits gracefully upon Cancel.

I have released a fix for export job not finishing upon error, but cannot 
reproduce the problem of plug-in not found with single plug-in version of 
which is changed.
Larry, can you provide exact steps that lead to the build error?
Thank you.

I think the changing version problem is same as described in bug 86950.
All should work now.
